lead_paragraph: A start-up in California is studying how self-driving vehicles will communicate with the world around them, as well as with their passengers.

headline.print_headline: Start-Up Imagines Driverless Vehicles That Can Tell You Where They’re Going
headline.main: How Driverless Cars May Interact With People

snippet: A start-up in California is studying how self-driving vehicles will communicate with the world around them, as well as with their passengers....
abstract: Start-up Drive.ai, based in California, outlines its plan for studying how self-driving cars could be designed to communicate safely and effectively with other drivers and pedestrians; leaning on artifical intelligence technology called 'deep learning,' researchers at Drive.ai plans to retrofit and test commercial fleet vehicles for tasks like parcel delivery and taxi services.
